StoreLimitsInput.title: StoreLimitsInput
StoreLimitsInput.description: Contains requested limitations regarding store usages.

max_byte_size.description: The maximum number of bytes the store can contains. The size of a triple is counted as the sum of the size of its subject, predicate and object, including the size of data types and language tags if any. If `None`, the default value of [Uint128::MAX] is used, which can be considered as no limit.

max_insert_data_byte_size.description: The maximum number of bytes an insert data query can contains. If `None`, the default value of [Uint128::MAX] is used, which can be considered as no limit.

max_insert_data_triple_count.description: The maximum number of triples an insert data query can contains (after parsing). If `None`, the default value of [Uint128::MAX] is used, which can be considered as no limit.

max_query_limit.description: The maximum limit of a query, i.e. the maximum number of triples returned by a select query. If `None`, the default value of 30 is used.

max_query_variable_count.description: The maximum number of variables a query can select. If `None`, the default value of 30 is used.

max_triple_byte_size.description: The maximum number of bytes the store can contains for a single triple. The size of a triple is counted as the sum of the size of its subject, predicate and object, including the size of data types and language tags if any. The limit is used to prevent storing very large triples, especially literals. If `None`, the default value of [Uint128::MAX] is used, which can be considered as no limit.

max_triple_count.description: The maximum number of triples the store can contains. If `None`, the default value of [Uint128::MAX] is used, which can be considered as no limit.

oneOf.title: InsertData
oneOf.description:
Insert the data as RDF triples in the store. For already existing triples it acts as no-op.

Only the smart contract owner (i.e. the address who instantiated it) is authorized to perform this action.

data.description: The data to insert. The data must be serialized in the format specified by the `format` field. And the data are subject to the limitations defined by the `limits` specified at contract instantiation.

format.description: The data format in which the triples are serialized. If not provided, the default format is [Turtle](https://www.w3.org/TR/turtle/) format.

oneOf.title: DeleteData
oneOf.description:
Delete the data (RDF triples) from the store matching the patterns defined by the provided query. For non-existing triples it acts as no-op.

Example: ```json { "prefixes": [ { "prefix": "foaf", "namespace": "http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/" } ], "delete": [ { "subject": { "variable": "s" }, "predicate": { "variable": "p" }, "object": { "variable": "o" } } ], "where": [ { "simple": { "triplePattern": { "subject": { "variable": "s" }, "predicate": { "node": { "namedNode": {"prefixed": "foaf:givenName"} } }, "object": { "literal": { "simple": "Myrddin" } } } } }, { "simple": { "triplePattern": { "subject": { "variable": "s" }, "predicate": { "variable": "p" }, "object": { "variable": "o" } } } } ] ```

Only the smart contract owner (i.e. the address who instantiated it) is authorized to perform this action.

prefixes.description: The prefixes used in the operation.

where.description: The WHERE clause to apply. If not provided, all the RDF triples are considered.

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

DataFormat.title: DataFormat
DataFormat.description: Represents the format in which the data are serialized, for example when returned by a query or when inserted in the store.

oneOf.title: Prefixed
oneOf.description: An IRI prefixed with a prefix. The prefixed IRI is expanded to a full IRI using the prefix definition specified in the query. For example, the prefixed IRI `rdf:type` is expanded to `http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type`.

oneOf.title: Simple
oneOf.description: A [simple literal](https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#dfn-simple-literal) without datatype or language form.

Node.title: Node
Node.description: Represents either an IRI (named node) or a blank node.

Prefix.title: Prefix
Prefix.description: Represents a prefix in a [SelectQuery]. A prefix is a shortcut for a namespace used in the query.

namespace.description: The namespace associated with the prefix.

SimpleWhereCondition.title: SimpleWhereCondition
SimpleWhereCondition.description: Represents a simple condition in a [WhereCondition].

oneOf.title: TriplePattern
oneOf.description: Represents a triple pattern, i.e. a condition on a triple based on its subject, predicate and object.

TriplePattern.title: TriplePattern
TriplePattern.description: Represents a triple pattern in a [SimpleWhereCondition].

object.description: The object of the triple pattern.

predicate.description: The predicate of the triple pattern.

subject.description: The subject of the triple pattern.

VarOrNode.title: VarOrNode
VarOrNode.description: Represents either a variable or a node.

oneOf.title: Node
oneOf.description: A node, i.e. an IRI or a blank node.

VarOrNodeOrLiteral.title: VarOrNodeOrLiteral
VarOrNodeOrLiteral.description: Represents either a variable, a node or a literal.

oneOf.title: Node
oneOf.description: A node, i.e. an IRI or a blank node.

oneOf.title: Literal
oneOf.description: An RDF [literal](https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#dfn-literal), i.e. a simple literal, a language-tagged string or a typed value.

oneOf.title: Store
oneOf.description: Returns information about the triple store.

oneOf.title: Select
oneOf.description: Returns the resources matching the criteria defined by the provided query.

oneOf.title: Describe
oneOf.description: Returns a description of the resource identified by the provided IRI as a set of RDF triples serialized in the provided format.

format.description: The format in which the triples are serialized. If not provided, the default format is [Turtle](https://www.w3.org/TR/turtle/) format.

DataFormat.title: DataFormat
DataFormat.description: Represents the format in which the data are serialized, for example when returned by a query or when inserted in the store.

DescribeQuery.title: DescribeQuery
DescribeQuery.description: Represents a DESCRIBE query over the triple store, allowing to retrieve a description of a resource as a set of triples serialized in a specific format.

prefixes.description: The prefixes used in the query.

resource.description: The resource to describe given as a variable or a node.

where.description: The WHERE clause. This clause is used to specify the resource identifier to describe using variable bindings.

oneOf.title: Prefixed
oneOf.description: An IRI prefixed with a prefix. The prefixed IRI is expanded to a full IRI using the prefix definition specified in the query. For example, the prefixed IRI `rdf:type` is expanded to `http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type`.

oneOf.title: Simple
oneOf.description: A [simple literal](https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#dfn-simple-literal) without datatype or language form.

Node.title: Node
Node.description: Represents either an IRI (named node) or a blank node.

Prefix.title: Prefix
Prefix.description: Represents a prefix in a [SelectQuery]. A prefix is a shortcut for a namespace used in the query.

namespace.description: The namespace associated with the prefix.

SelectItem.title: SelectItem
SelectItem.description: Represents an item to select in a [SelectQuery].

SelectQuery.title: SelectQuery
SelectQuery.description: Represents a SELECT query over the triple store, allowing to select variables to return and to filter the results.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return. If `None`, there is no limit. Note: the value of the limit cannot exceed the maximum query limit defined in the store limitations.

prefixes.description: The prefixes used in the query.

select.description: The items to select. Note: the number of items to select cannot exceed the maximum query variable count defined in the store limitations.

where.description: The WHERE clause. If `None`, there is no WHERE clause, i.e. all triples are returned without filtering.

SimpleWhereCondition.title: SimpleWhereCondition
SimpleWhereCondition.description: Represents a simple condition in a [WhereCondition].

oneOf.title: TriplePattern
oneOf.description: Represents a triple pattern, i.e. a condition on a triple based on its subject, predicate and object.

TriplePattern.title: TriplePattern
TriplePattern.description: Represents a triple pattern in a [SimpleWhereCondition].

object.description: The object of the triple pattern.

predicate.description: The predicate of the triple pattern.

subject.description: The subject of the triple pattern.

VarOrNode.title: VarOrNode
VarOrNode.description: Represents either a variable or a node.

oneOf.title: Node
oneOf.description: A node, i.e. an IRI or a blank node.

VarOrNodeOrLiteral.title: VarOrNodeOrLiteral
VarOrNodeOrLiteral.description: Represents either a variable, a node or a literal.

oneOf.title: Node
oneOf.description: A node, i.e. an IRI or a blank node.

oneOf.title: Literal
oneOf.description: An RDF [literal](https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#dfn-literal), i.e. a simple literal, a language-tagged string or a typed value.

describe.title: DescribeResponse
describe.description: Represents the response of a [QueryMsg::Describe] query.

data.description: The data serialized in the specified format.

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

DataFormat.title: DataFormat
DataFormat.description: Represents the format in which the data are serialized, for example when returned by a query or when inserted in the store.

select.title: SelectResponse
select.description: Represents the response of a [QueryMsg::Select] query.

head.description: The head of the response, i.e. the set of variables mentioned in the results.

results.description: The results of the select query.

vars.description: The variables selected in the query.

oneOf.title: Prefixed
oneOf.description: An IRI prefixed with a prefix. The prefixed IRI is expanded to a full IRI using the prefix definition specified in the query. For example, the prefixed IRI `rdf:type` is expanded to `http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type`.

oneOf.title: Literal
oneOf.description: Represents a literal S with optional language tag L or datatype IRI D.

xml:lang.description: The language tag of the literal.

value.description: The identifier of the blank node.

store.title: StoreResponse
store.description: Contains information related to triple store.

max_byte_size.description: The maximum number of bytes the store can contains. The size of a triple is counted as the sum of the size of its subject, predicate and object, including the size of data types and language tags if any.

max_insert_data_byte_size.description: The maximum number of bytes an insert data query can contains.

max_insert_data_triple_count.description: The maximum number of triples an insert data query can contains (after parsing).

max_query_limit.description: The maximum limit of a query, i.e. the maximum number of triples returned by a select query.

max_query_variable_count.description: The maximum number of variables a query can select.

max_triple_byte_size.description: The maximum number of bytes the store can contains for a single triple. The size of a triple is counted as the sum of the size of its subject, predicate and object, including the size of data types and language tags if any. The limit is used to prevent storing very large triples, especially literals.

max_triple_count.description: The maximum number of triples the store can contains.

StoreStat.title: StoreStat
StoreStat.description: Contains usage information about the triple store.

byte_size.description: The total triple size in the store, in bytes.

namespace_count.description: The total number of IRI namespace present in the store.

triple_count.description: The total number of triple present in the store.

description:
# Triplestore

## Overview

The `okp4-cognitarium` smart contract enables the storage of RDF graphs triples (i.e. `subject`-`predicate`-`object`) in any [Cosmos blockchains](https://cosmos.network/) using the [CosmWasm](https://cosmwasm.com/) framework.
title: okp4-cognitarium
